Title: Lan City Noodle Bar (Ann Arbor)
Address: 1235 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "Fantastic food and service üëå üòã Super friendly staff."
"My Husband ordered the CKT and soup dumplings, he really enjoyed both dishes."
"I like the variety of flavors, noodles, and small plates."

most_relevant.description: This place is extremely underrated. One of my close friends told me these are the best noodles I‚Äôll get in all of Ann Arbor and he was not wrong. I got the Peking Pork and couldn‚Äôt be more content with my decision. The noodles are the star of the show and that‚Äôs not saying the pork wasn‚Äôt good. Prices are affordable and you will be getting your food in under 20 minutes. I 100% recommend you stopping by you won‚Äôt regret it!

One of our favorites for when we want a variety of Asian food. Their Pho was so delicious and comforting and the noodles were amazing! Their chicken in the sesame chicken was also delicious - so much meat and the perfect amount of breading. The crab Rangoon were pretty good but not the best in town I‚Äôd say.
This place is seat yourself. You order at the counter, take a buzzer, and find a seat. It can get busy but usually there‚Äôs space to sit.

This place is my main place to eat in Ann Arbor. There‚Äôs just something that you have to love about fresh noodles and appropriately balanced flavors that just soothes one‚Äôs soul, and Lan City Noodle Bar definitely hits that spot.

I like the variety of flavors, noodles, and small plates. Many dishes go well together and I end up getting different combinations each time I go (though my son prefers the dumplings always).

Very straightforward and outgoing ladies have taken my order every time I‚Äôve been there, and explained the system for picking up your food. Things can stagger when they come out, so the best bet if you are really hungry may just be to order more (we generally order 4-6 items so something usually comes out quick).

Love this place, don‚Äôt change, and keep the wings spicy!

My girlfriend, Sarah, and I came here for the first time today. We ordered the pad Thai, sesame chicken, and the hot chili oil noodles. Ordering was super easy and sat down with a pager, but the wait time was ~20 minutes. The food was okay, we loved the hot chili oil noodles especially (FYI it was spicy), but the pad Thai didn‚Äôt taste like pad Thai at all. The sesame chicken sauce was good, but the chicken bites were very large and hard to eat. After a few pieces of chicken we couldn‚Äôt eat the rest. The atmosphere of the restaurant was good and was overall very clean.

I don't like rating this place low but here we are. Last year I'd come here all the time, it was quick, cheap, and pretty good. Service was never the strong suit, but I think they've changed staff recently because now the service is somehow even worse. There are more than enough vaguely East Asian restaurants in Ann Arbor that this place can't really afford to start dropping the ball like this.
Many noodles to try one and Boba drink a lot of choice as well üçúüßã side dish in a pretty good size. Overall this is good place for nice warm bowl of noodle ü§é

I'm not sure if they know what vegetarian means? I asked for vegetable noodle soup with vegetable broth and double checked with them to make sure it was vegetarian, but for some reason it included a fly, which (last time I checked) isn't vegetarian?

I brought this to the attention of the manager, and she told me it was seaweed. I've never seen seaweed with wings, but maybe they use a special kind of seaweed? She then stirred it around to make sure the flying seaweed was at the bottom of the bowl and harder to see. I showed her a picture of what she claimed to be seaweed and she panicked and offered to get me another bowl of the flying seaweed soup, free of charge. Unfortunately, since I'm vegetarian, I can't eat flies, so I declined her kind offer.

You can be the judge of that picture down below. Maybe I'm wrong? I wasn't the best in biology, so maybe I missed the part in class where they taught us that seaweed grows wings after being cooked.

Only reason this isn't a one star review is because their classic fried rice is good as hell and that one lady on the staff who is usually there is really nice.

Probably my favorite place to eat in the city. I loved dining here when I was in college and I still stop in when I visit. The portion sizes are great for the price. (I usually split the sesame chicken with another person)
